intro: Streblosa bracteata, commonly known as the bracted streblosa, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive bracteate inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with lanceolate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
